name: Radisson Blu Waterfront Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in Stockholm, want a breathtaking view? Go for this hotel and ask for a room with a view of city hall! Dont forget to bring your camera!
reviews.title: First time in Stockholm?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With its location in the middle ofStockholm it's a grate place for the tourist or business traveller. 100 meters to T cantralen the communication hub of Stockholm.
reviews.title: Good for lesuire or business

reviews.text: Breakfast is grate, staff helpfull and friendly.
reviews.title: Great property and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a busy hotel so be prepared for the breakfasts to be packed. Location wise the hotel is across from the terminal so you can jump off the bus or train and walk to your hotel. You fairly central so it's a short walk to the main tourist hop n hop off bus stops. The view from the room is truely awesome - you look out across the waterway which is the highlight for us.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, great service, light, clean, modern, and good food. If you are visiting Stockholm for business or leisure, either way, this is a good pick. Try arranging for a business room, so you also have a nespresso type coffee maker in the room. Bed is good, bathroom is modern and clean, whic is a must.
reviews.title: Very good modern hotel next to Central Station.

reviews.text: This is a superb hotel, incredibly easy to reach from the airport train and very close to the old town and the city shops. The rooms are fresh, modern, very comfortable and well appointed. Staff were very welcoming and helpful through all departments. I would go out of my way to stay here again.. Even from Australia!
reviews.title: A superb experience

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel only one night, but we were impressed with the service. From the moment we approached the reception we were greeted with big smiles and very helpful staff. The breakfast was just magnificent. There was so much to choose from that we kept going back for more during the whole breakfast :) The hotel has also a very central location. Couple of minutes from the train station and 15 min walk to the old city (Gamla Stan). Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great stay!!

reviews.text: This hotel is located close to the central station of Stockholm and almost next to the train Arlanda Expressen's stop in Stockholm, which makes it easy to access. The rooms are nice and the quality is generally high compared to some of the closest hotels. The restaurant was okay but there are many alternatives near by. It is a good stay but also a bit pricy compared to some of the neighboring hotels.
reviews.title: Nice business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is one of radisson hotel in Stockholm, and we choose this one because it is new. On check-in I ask about highest floor and City Hall view (water view). I was told that all water view rooms are business class. So I need to pay extra.. But when we enter the room we look through the window for 15 minutes. View is breathtaking! You need no excursions or sightseeing tours because it all in your room view!
reviews.title: view you never forget

reviews.text: Spacious, clean rooms, warm bathroom floor(!), good view, excellent staff and service, convenient location to everything. The only drawback (and the only reason why I have given a 4 instead of 5) is that the price for breakfast has steeply jumped from SEK112 to SEK195 starting 2013. (I made the booking in Dec 2012 not knowing there would be such a big jump. If I had I might have booked a room w/ breakfast package instead).
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the Flybus for our 2 return legs between the airport and city, instead of the Arlanda Express, and find it absolutely cheap (SEK99 one-way) and convenient (45 minutes, stops right outside Terminals 4 & 5). The City Terminal is in front of the hotel across the road, no more than 5 minutes' walk with luggage.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: If you come by the train or T-bahn you should look for the signage for congress centre. The name of the hotel is not mentioned on the official signages inside the station hall. (Or we just couldn't find them!)
reviews.title: Great location & Rooms with Views

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel, The staff bent over backwards to assist us. The location next to central station is the best. We took the train from the airport and you are there at the hotel. It is central to everything. We found good food all a walking distance away.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a short cab trip to the castle.
reviews.title: Nice stay during our first night in Stockholm

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights at the end of our holiday, visiting my daughter and found the Radisson Blu Waterfront to be excellent. It is very nice in it's design and every employee seem to go out of their way to assist. The rooms are modern and spacious by European standards. The best was the heated floor in the bathroom. Overall a very good hotel very centrally located.
reviews.title: A great hotel next to central station

reviews.text: As I arrived on an Alranda express train it was a pleasant surprise to find out an entrance to the hotel right in 15 foot steps from metro doors. The room is spacious, with tea amenities and mini-bar. The water view is great, especially in the evenings when you see the city in red and blue colors at the sunset.
reviews.title: A good, no-frills Radisson

reviews.text: Breakfast is good, there is a choice of standard morning staff like eggs, scrambled or boiled, sausages, beacon, potatoes, mushrooms, muesli, porridge, jams, fresh juice, ets. In addition there are tradition Swedish specialities like smoked salmon, herrings, liver pâté, pickles and grain dark bread.
reviews.title: great location for family and business

reviews.text: The personnel is very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great value for money. Good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately there is no sauna or swimming pool, only gym.
reviews.title: Best location, perfect rooms!

description: Unwind and retreat at this new luxury hotel next to the Stockholm Waterfront Congress Centre, the area's premier events and conference venue. This exceptional hotel, located in the heart of Stockholm, affords instant access to the best of the city; from restaurants and nightlife to the Old Town and the Royal Palace, guests enjoy quick access to the area's most interesting attractions. Attached to the Stockholm Waterfront Congress Centre, the hotel is the perfection option for visiting delegates.Enjoy instant access to the Stockholm Waterfront Congress Centre, attached to the hotel and featuring 22 meeting rooms spread over 15,000 square metres. Relax in one of 414 modern rooms and suites, complete with Free high-speed, wireless Internet access and spectacular views over Riddarfjärden and Stockholm’s City Hall. Savor international cuisine and perfectly mixed cocktails at the hotel's on-site restaurant and the Lobby Bar that features an open fireplace. Recharge at the hotel's on-site Exercise Lounge, and take advantage of 24-hour room service, Business Centre and Free high-speed, wireless Internet access. Meet with ease at the premier Stockholm Waterfront Congress Centre, which is attached to the hotel and features some of the world's best conference facilities with cutting edge AV equipment and exemplary, knowledgeable staff.
